trans-unit.source: How to: Add Portal Administrators
trans-unit.target: How to: Add Portal Administrators

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Add Portal Administrators
trans-unit.target: How to: Add Portal Administrators

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: In <token>firstref_acs</token>, <newTerm>portal administrators</newTerm> are users who have access rights to a particular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: In <token>firstref_acs</token>, <newTerm>portal administrators</newTerm> are users who have access rights to a particular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to add portal administrators.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to add portal administrators.

trans-unit.source: For more information about portal administrators, see <link xlink:href="a67f7e99-a7dd-4cfc-b214-a653a00a2783" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Portal Administrators</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about portal administrators, see <link xlink:href="a67f7e99-a7dd-4cfc-b214-a653a00a2783" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Portal Administrators</link>.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: To add new portal administrators, complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add new portal administrators, complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Review Identity Providers in the Access Control Namespace
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Review Identity Providers in the Access Control Namespace

trans-unit.source: When you create an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, <token>secondref_acs</token> creates a default portal administrator account.
trans-unit.target: When you create an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, <token>secondref_acs</token> creates a default portal administrator account.

trans-unit.source: The value is <token>ms_acct</token> of the user who created the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: The value is <token>ms_acct</token> of the user who created the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> also adds <token>windows_live_id</token> as an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> also adds <token>windows_live_id</token> as an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: If the user account that you want to promote is hosted by an identity provider other than <token>windows_live_id</token>, you need to add that identity provider to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and then promote the user account.
trans-unit.target: If the user account that you want to promote is hosted by an identity provider other than <token>windows_live_id</token>, you need to add that identity provider to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and then promote the user account.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal uses federated identities for management.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal uses federated identities for management.

trans-unit.source: As a result, administrative accounts in the portal are hosted by identity providers, not by the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.
trans-unit.target: As a result, administrative accounts in the portal are hosted by identity providers, not by the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.

trans-unit.source: To promote a user to an <token>secondref_acs</token> portal administrator, you must first add the identity provider that is hosting the user account to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: To promote a user to an <token>secondref_acs</token> portal administrator, you must first add the identity provider that is hosting the user account to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: To add an identity provider
trans-unit.target: To add an identity provider

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Identity providers</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Identity providers</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If the identity provider that hosts the user account is not listed, add the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: If the identity provider that hosts the user account is not listed, add the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Identity Providers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Identity Providers</link>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Add a Portal Administrator
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Add a Portal Administrator

trans-unit.source: After the identity provider that host the user account is added to the namespace, you can promote the user to a portal administrator.
trans-unit.target: After the identity provider that host the user account is added to the namespace, you can promote the user to a portal administrator.

trans-unit.source: To add a portal administrator
trans-unit.target: To add a portal administrator

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Portal administrators</ui> and then click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Portal administrators</ui> and then click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Portal Administrator</ui> page, select the identity provider that hosts the user account.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Portal Administrator</ui> page, select the identity provider that hosts the user account.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Identity claim type</ui>, select a claim type that can uniquely identify the user.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Identity claim type</ui>, select a claim type that can uniquely identify the user.

trans-unit.source: By default, the menu displays all claim types that are supported by the identity provider and included in the metadata that <token>secondref_acs</token> imports.
trans-unit.target: By default, the menu displays all claim types that are supported by the identity provider and included in the metadata that <token>secondref_acs</token> imports.

trans-unit.source: It is critically important that the selected claim type uniquely identify an individual user account (or a security group).
trans-unit.target: It is critically important that the selected claim type uniquely identify an individual user account (or a security group).

trans-unit.source: The following claim types qualify.
trans-unit.target: The following claim types qualify.

trans-unit.source: EmailAddress
trans-unit.target: EmailAddress

trans-unit.source: NameIdentitifer (if the value is known)
trans-unit.target: NameIdentitifer (if the value is known)

trans-unit.source: UPN
trans-unit.target: UPN

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Identity claim value</ui>, enter a value for the claim type.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Identity claim value</ui>, enter a value for the claim type.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you selected an <ui>EmailAddress</ui> claim type, enter the email address of the user, such as <userInput>johnsmith@contoso.com</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you selected an <ui>EmailAddress</ui> claim type, enter the email address of the user, such as <userInput>johnsmith@contoso.com</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In <token>secondref_acs</token> 2.0, identity claim values are case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: In <token>secondref_acs</token> 2.0, identity claim values are case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Description</ui>, enter a description for the portal administrator.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Description</ui>, enter a description for the portal administrator.

trans-unit.source: This field is optional.
trans-unit.target: This field is optional.

trans-unit.source: If a claim type is supported by the identity provider, but is not listed, you can use the <ui>Enter claim type</ui> option to create a custom claim type.
trans-unit.target: If a claim type is supported by the identity provider, but is not listed, you can use the <ui>Enter claim type</ui> option to create a custom claim type.

trans-unit.source: In the value of the <ui>Enter claim type</ui> option, specify the URI for the custom claim type.
trans-unit.target: In the value of the <ui>Enter claim type</ui> option, specify the URI for the custom claim type.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 - Provide the Portal URL to the Portal Administrators
trans-unit.target: Step 3 - Provide the Portal URL to the Portal Administrators

trans-unit.source: When you save a new portal administrator, the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal redirects you to the <ui>Portal Administrators</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: When you save a new portal administrator, the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal redirects you to the <ui>Portal Administrators</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: The display includes a URL that can open the management portal for the namespace.
trans-unit.target: The display includes a URL that can open the management portal for the namespace.

trans-unit.source: Provide this URL to the new portal administrator.
trans-unit.target: Provide this URL to the new portal administrator.

trans-unit.source: The portal administrator URL cannot be used to access the Azure Management Portal to add or manage other <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.
trans-unit.target: The portal administrator URL cannot be used to access the Azure Management Portal to add or manage other <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.
